meanings.definition: Someone who belittles or disparages others.
meanings.sent1: The belittler in the group always made fun of others.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the belittler because she often made hurtful comments about her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The belittler's jokes were never funny; they just made people feel bad.
meanings.sent4: His role as the belittler in the office made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The belittler's words were like tiny arrows, poking at people's self-esteem.

meanings.definition: To make someone or something seem less impressive or important.
meanings.sent1: She would always belittle her sister's achievements.
meanings.sent2: He didn't mean to belittle her efforts; he just didn't understand the hard work she put in.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to belittle the dog's bone, but the dog didn't care.
meanings.sent4: The storm's power seemed to belittle all human efforts to stop it.
meanings.sent5: His words had the power to belittle even the grandest of ideas.

meanings.sent1: She would often belittle her coworkers behind their backs.
meanings.sent2: He didn't realize how much he belittled her dreams with his constant criticism.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's job was to belittle everything, but sometimes it just felt mean.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to belittle the trees as it howled through the forest.
meanings.sent5: Her words had the power to belittle even the strongest of arguments.
